intro: Icacorea apoda, commonly known as the slender icacurea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in shrubland and forest understory habitats. Icacorea apoda is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
